• Ciontóirí gnéis agus gáinneála drugaí
there is a wide range of sentences available to a judge who is sentencing someone found guilty of a criminal offence in Ireland
Tá réimse leathan de phianbhreitheanna ar fáil do bhreitheamh atá ag cur pianbhreithe ar dhuine a fuarthas ciontach i gcion coiriúil in Éirinn
These sentences may be custodial or non-custodial and include:
Is féidir le pianbhreith a bheith ina pianbhreith choimeádta nó eile, agus áirítear na pianbhreitheanna seo a leanas leo:
• Curfews and exclusion orders
• Cuirfiúnna agus orduithe eisiata
Depending on the offence, secondary non-custodial options may be appropriate, such as, disqualification, confiscation and compensation
Ag brath ar an gcion, d'fhéadfadh go mbeadh roghanna oiriúnach nach pianbhreitheanna coimeádta iad, mar shampla dícháiliú, coigistiú agus cúiteamh
There are additional options for sex and drug trafficking offenders
Tá roghanna eile ann do chiontóirí gnéis nó gáinneála drugaí
There are three specific types of imprisonment options available to a judge:
Tá trí chineál shainiúla de roghanna príosúnachta ar fáil do bhreitheamh:
A mandatory sentence is one which must be imposed regardless of any other circumstances
Is éard is pianbhreith shainordaitheach ann ná pianbhreith a gcaithfear í a chur ar dhuine gan aird ar aon chúinsí eile
In Ireland, murder carries a mandatory sentence of life imprisonment
In Éirinn, tá pianbhreith shainordaitheach de phríosúnacht saoil ag baint le dúnmharú
A life sentence lasts for life
Maireann pianbhreith saoil ar feadh an tsaoil
As is the case in a number of countries, however, not all of the life sentence in Ireland is generally served in prison custody
Mar a tharlaíonn i roinnt tíortha áfach, ní hiondúil go ndéantar gach cuid den phianbhreith saoil a chaitheamh i bpríosún in Éirinn
The granting of temporary or early release of life sentenced prisoners is a feature of prison systems internationally and in Ireland
Is gné de chórais príosúin go hidirnáisiúnta agus in Éirinn é príosúnaigh faoi phianbhreith a scaoileadh go sealadach nó go luath
The Minister for Justice and Equality, in deciding on the release from prison of a life sentenced prisoner, always considers the advice and recommendations of the Parole Board of Ireland

Déanann an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais comhairle agus moltaí an Bhoird Parúil a chur san áireamh i gcónaí agus cinneadh á dhéanamh aige maidir le príosúnach faoi phianbhreith saoil a scaoileadh as príosún
At present, the Board initially reviews prisoners who have been sentenced to life imprisonment after they have served 7 years
Faoi láthair, déanann an Bord athbhreithniú ar phríosúnaigh faoi phianbhreith saoil i ndiaidh dóibh 7 mbliana a chaitheamh sa phríosún

Prisoners serving very long sentences (including life sentences), are normally reviewed on a number of occasions over a number of years before any substantial concessions would be recommended by the Board

Go hiondúil, déantar roinnt athbhreithnithe ar phríosúnaigh faoi phianbhreith fhada (lena n-áirítear pianbhreith saoil) thar roinnt blianta sula ndéanfadh an Bord moladh maidir le lamháltais thábhachtacha
The final decision as to whether a life sentenced prisoner is released, rests solely with the Minister
Is faoin Aire amháin atá sé an cinneadh deiridh a dhéanamh maidir le príosúnach faoi phianbhreith saoil a scaoileadh
The length of time spent in custody by offenders serving life sentences can vary substantially
D'fhéadfadh go mbeadh éagsúlachtaí móra ag baint leis na tréimhsí ama faoi choimeád a chaitheann ciontóirí faoi phianbhreith saoil
Of those prisoners serving life sentences who have been released, the average sentence served in prison is approximately 12 years
Is é 12 bhliain go neasach an mheántréimhse a chaitear sa phríosún ag daoine faoi phianbhreith saoil ar scaoileadh saor iad
This, however, is only an average; there are prisoners serving life sentences in Ireland who have spent in excess of thirty years in custody
Níl anseo ach an mheántréimhse áfach; tá príosúnaigh faoi phianbhreith saoil in Éirinn atá sa phríosún le os cionn tríocha bliain
The law lays down maximum sentences for all crimes
Tá uas-phianbhreitheanna maidir le gach coir leagtha amach ag an dlí
For example, if you are found guilty of violent disorder under Section 15 of the Criminal Justice (Public Order) Act 1994, the maximum sentence you can receive is 10 years imprisonment
Mar shampla, má fhaightear ciontach thú i mí-ord foréigneach faoi Alt 15 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Ord Poiblí) 1994, is é príosúnacht 10 mbliana an uas-phianbhreith ar féidir a chur ort
The maximum sentence is used as a starting point by a judge when deciding on what sentence to impose
Úsáideann an breitheamh an uas-phianbhreith mar phointe tosaithe agus cinneadh á dhéanamh aige maidir leis an bpianbhreith a ghearradh
Generally, sentencing is left to the discretion of the judge
Fágtar an phianbhreith faoi rogha an bhreithimh go hiondúil
There are however, are a number of laws which take this discretion away from the judge and obliges the judge to impose at least a minimum sentence
Tá roinnt dlíthe ann áfach, a bhaineann an discréid seo den bhreitheamh agus a chuireann iallach air íos-phianbhreith áirithe ar a laghad a ghearradh

If, for example, you are found guilty of possession of drugs with a value greater than €13,000 under Section 15A of the Misuse of Drugs Act 1977 , Section 27 of the Act as amended by Section 33 of the Criminal Justice Act 2007 (pdf) provides for a minimum sentence of 10 years imprisonment

Mar shampla, tá foráil ann d'íos-phianbhreith de phríosúnacht 10 mbliana má fhaightear ciontach thú i sealbhú drugaí ar €13,000 nó níos mó a luach faoi Alt 15A den Acht um Mí-Úsáid Drugaí 1977, Alt 27 den Acht arna leasú ag Alt 33 den Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2007 (pdf)
Similarly, the Criminal Justice Act 2006 (pdf) has introduced a number of new offences in relation to firearms which carry a minimum sentence if you are convicted on indictment
Ar an gcaoi chéanna, tá cionta nua tugtha isteach ag an Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 (pdf) maidir le hairm tine lena mbaineann íos-phianbhreith má chiontaítear thú ar díotáil
If it is your first offence, the judge has discretion to impose a lesser sentence, having regard to such things as a guilty plea or assistance provided to the Gardaí
Más é do chéad chion é, tá sé de rogha ag an mbreitheamh pianbhreith níos lú a ghearradh, ag féachaint do nithe eile, mar shampla, pléadáil chiontach nó cúnamh a tugadh do na Gardaí
If, however, it your second or subsequent drugs/firearms offence, then the minimum sentence applies
Más é do dara cion nó níos mó é maidir le drugaí nó le hairm tine áfach, cuirfear an íos-phianbhreith i bhfeidhm
See "Further information" below on mandatory minimum sentences for firearm offences
Feach "Tuilleadh eolais" thíos maidir le híos-phianbhreitheanna sainordaitheacha do chionta airm tine
A suspended sentence involves the judge imposing a prison sentence but suspending it on certain conditions
Is éard atá i bpianbhreith ar fionraí ná go ndéanann an breitheamh pianbhreith phríosúin a ghearradh ach go gcuireann sé ar fionraí í ar choinníollacha áirithe
This means that you do not go to prison if you do not break the conditions
Mar sin, ní théann tú go príosún mura mbriseann tú na coinníollacha
A suspended sentence contains 3 elements:
Tá 3 chomhpháirt i gceist le pianbhreith ar fionraí:
• The term of imprisonment (for example, 4 years)
• An téarma príosúnachta (mar shampla, 4 bliana)
• The conditions on which it is suspended (for example, to keep the peace and be of good behaviour or to undergo certain treatment)
• Na coinníollacha a bhaineann lena chur ar fionraí (mar shampla, an tsíocháin a choimeád agus a bheith dea-iomprach nó cóireáil áirithe a fhulaingt)
• The period for which the sentence is suspended
• An tréimhse lena gcuirtear an phianbhreith ar fionraí
If you break a condition during the period for which the sentence is suspended, you will have to serve the term of imprisonment originally imposed
Má bhriseann tú ceann de na coinníollacha laistigh den tréimhse ama lena bhfuil an phianbhreith ar fionraí, beidh ort an téarma príosúnachta a ghearradh ort ar dtús a fhulaingt
Community service orders (CSOs) are provided for by the Criminal Justice (Community Service) Act 1983
Forálann An tAcht um Cheartas Coiriúil (Seirbhís Pobail) 1983 d'orduithe seirbhíse pobail
For your punishment, you are required to do some work which is beneficial to the community
Caithfidh tú obair éigin a dhéanamh do leas an phobail mar phionós
CSOs are imposed by a judge instead of a prison sentence
Gearrann breitheamh orduithe seirbhíse pobail in áit phianbhreitheanna príosúnachta
A number of considerations must be met before a CSO can be made by a judge:
Ní mór roinnt comaoineacha a chomhlíonadh sula féidir le breitheamh ordú seirbhíse pobail a ghearradh:
• You must be suitable for community service (The judge orders a probation report to decide whether you are suitable for a CSO)
• Ní mór duit a bheith oiriúnach do sheirbhís phobail (Ordaíonn an breitheamh tuairisc phromhaidh agus leasa le cinneadh go bhfuil tú oiriúnach d'ordú seirbhíse pobail)
• Suitable community work must be available for you to do
• Ní mór go mbeadh obair pobail oiriúnach ar fáil duit
• You must agree to the CSO
• Ní mór duit aontú leis an ordú seirbhíse pobail
The total number of hours of community service cannot exceed 240 hours and you must complete the community service within one year of the making of the order
Ní féidir le líon iomlán na n-uaireanta don ordú seirbhíse pobail a bheith os cionn 240 uair, agus ní mór duit an tseirbhís phobail a chríochnú laistigh d'aon bhliain amháin den ordú
Many offences provide for a fine to be imposed
Forálann go leor cionta d'fhíneáil a ghearradh
Often, offences will provide for a fine and/or another punishment (usually a prison sentence), while other offences attract only a fine
Go minic, forálfaidh cionta d'fhíneáil agus/nó do phionós eile (pianbhreith príosúin de ghnáth), agus ní bheidh i gceist le cionta eile ach fíneáil amháin
If a fine exceeds a certain amount (class A fine) it may take the offence outside the jurisdiction of the District Court which can only deal with minor offences
Má bhíonn méid na fíneála os cionn méid áirithe (rang A fíneáil), d'fhéadfadh go mbeadh an cion lasmuigh de dhlínse na Cúirte Dúiche, toisc nach bpléann sé ach le mionchionta
When a fine is imposed, the judges normally specifies a period of time within which you must pay the fine
Nuair a ghearrtar fíneáil, is iondúil go sonraíonn an breitheamh tréimhse ama ina gcaithfidh tú an fhíneáil a íoc
If the fine is not paid within the time provided by the judge, you can be sent to prison for a time in default of the payment
Mura n-íoctar an fhíneáil laistigh den tréimhse ama sonraithe ag an mbreitheamh, d'fhéadfaí thú a chur i bpríosún ar feadh tréimhse d'éagmais na híocaíochta
In the District Court, the imprisonment default periods are as follows:
Is iad seo a leanas na tréimhsí íocaíochta réamhshocraithe sa Chúirt Dúiche:
Default periods in prison for not paying fines
Tréimhsí réamhshocraithe i bpríosún de bharr gan fíneálacha a íoc
│Less than €64 │ 5 days │
│Faoi bhun €64 │5 lá │
│Between €64 and €318 │ 15 days │
│Idir €64 agus €318 │15 lá │
│Between €318 and €635 │ 45 days │
│Idir €318 agus €635│45 lá │
│Greater than €635 │ 90 days │
│Os cionn €635 │90 lá │
Curfews and exclusion orders
Cuirfiúnna agus orduithe eisiata
Judges sometimes use curfews and/or exclusion orders as a sentencing option
Uaireanta, baineann breithiúna úsáid as cuirfiúnna agus/nó orduithe eisiata mar rogha pianbhreithe
Often, such an order takes the form of a condition of bail or of a suspended sentence
Go minic, beidh ordú mar seo i bhfoirm coinníll bannaí nó de phianbhreith ar fionraí
The court may make an order requiring you to be at home at a particular address between certain hours of the day or night
D'fhéadfadh an chúirt ordú a dhéanamh a chuirfeadh iallach ort a bheith sa bhaile ag seoladh ar leith idir uaireanta áirithe den lá nó den oíche
Similarly, the judge might ban you from entering a certain street or premises, for example, a pub or licensed premises
Ar an gcaoi chéanna, d'fhéadfadh an breitheamh cosc a chur ort a bheith ar shráid áirithe nó dul isteach in áitreabh áirithe, mar shampla teach tabhairne nó áitreabh ceadúnaithe
Under the Criminal Justice Act 2006 the court can impose restriction on movement orders
Is féidir leis an gcúirt orduithe srianta gluaiseachta a ghearradh faoin Acht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006
This may be imposed if you are convicted of certain offences (mainly public order and assault offences) and you are sentenced to imprisonment of three months or more
Is féidir iad a ghearradh má chiontaítear thú i gcionta áirithe (cionta a bhaineann le hord poiblí agus le hionsaí den chuid is mó) agus má ghearrtar príosúnacht de níos mó 3 mhí ort
The Act also provides that compliance with such orders may be electronically monitored
Forálann an tAcht freisin gur féidir monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar chomhlíonadh orduithe dá leithéid go leictreonach
However, this has not yet been implemented
Níl an fhoráil seo curtha i bhfeidhm go fóill áfach
There is more information in the document on restriction on movement orders
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil sa doiciméad maidir le horduithe srianta gluaiseachta

The Probation of Offenders Act 1907 provides the courts with a way of dealing with first time offenders and offenders who are unlikely to be in trouble again, by giving them a type of official warning without imposing a sentence on them

Soláthraíonn an Probation of Offenders Act 1907 bealach do na cúirteanna déileáil le ciontóirí céaduaire agus le ciontóirí nach cosúil go mbeidh i dtrioblóid arís, trí chineál de rabhadh oifigiúil a thabhairt dóibh gan pianbhreith a ghearradh orthu
If a probation order is made, as well as requiring you to be of good behaviour, it may also contain certain conditions such as:
Dá ndéanfaí ordú promhaidh, d'fhéadfadh sé coinníollacha áirithe eile a chur ort, chomh maith le héileamh ort a bheith dea-iomprach, mar seo a leanas:
• Residing at a particular place
• Cónaí in áit áirithe
• Any other conditions considered necessary to prevent a repeat of the offence (for example, attending counselling)
• Aon choinníoll eile a mheastar a bheith riachtanach chun athdhéanamh an chiona a sheachadadh (mar shampla, freastal ar chomhairleoireacht)
In addition to the court’s power to make a probation order there is a long standing power that allows the court to bind you over to keep the peace and be of good behaviour
I dteannta le cumhacht na cúirte ordú promhaidh a dhéanamh, tá seanchumhacht ann a cheadaíonn don chúirt banna a chur ort an tsíocháin a choinneáil agus a bheith dea-iomprach
This involves you entering into a recognisance (or monetary bond) for a period of time
Is éard atá i gceist ná go dtéann tú i gcúirtbhanna (nó banna airgeadais) at feadh tréimhse ama
If you get into trouble within the time stated in the order, you must pay that sum of money or face imprisonment
Má bhíonn tú in achrann laistigh den tréimhse ama atá sonraithe san ordú, beidh ort an méid sin airgid a íoc nó tá seans go gcuirfear i bpríosún thú
The Court Poor Box is another way judges have of dealing with less serious offences in the District Court
Is bealach eile é an Bosca Déirce atá ag breithiúna chun déileáil le cionta nach cionta tromchúiseacha iad sa Chúirt Dúiche
You may be required, if you agree, to pay a sum of money into the Court Poor Box
D'fhéadfaí iallach a chur ort, dá n-aontófá, méid airgid a íoc isteach i mBosca Déirce na Cúirte
Usually this is as an alternative to having a conviction recorded against you
De ghnáth, déantar é seo mar mhalairt ar chion a thaifeadadh i d'aghaidh
The option is only likely to be considered by judges for first time offenders who have committed minor offences, such as, littering or parking offences
Is dóigh nach ndéanfaidh breithiúna an rogha seo a bhreithniú ach amháin maidir le ciontóirí céaduaire a rinne mionchionta, mar shampla bruscar a chaitheamh nó cionta páirceála
This option is only available where you plead guilty or where there are special circumstances explaining your behaviour
Níl an rogha seo ar fáil ach amháin má phléadálann tú ciontach nó má bhíonn cúinsí áirithe ann a mhíníonn d'iompar
There is more information in the document on the Court Poor Box
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil sa doiciméad maidir le Bosca Déirce na Cúirte
Various laws provide judges with the power to order property, which is connected with the offence you have been convicted of, to be forfeited or confiscated
Tugann dlíthe éagsúla an chumhacht do bhreithiúna orduithe a dhéanamh maidir le sealúchas a bhaineann leis an gcion inar ciontaíodh thú a fhorghéilleadh nó a choigistiú
For example, under Section 10 of the Censorship of Publications Act 1929 prohibited publications may be confiscated
Mar shampla, d'fhéadfaí foilseacháin thoirmiscthe a choigistiú faoi Alt 10 den Acht um Scrúdóireacht Fhoillseachán 1929
The Criminal Justice Act 1993 gives judges the power, upon your conviction, to order you to pay compensation
Tugann an tAcht um Cheartas Coiriúil 1993 an chumhacht do bhreithiúna ordú duit cúiteamh a íoc nuair a chiontaítear thú
This may be in addition to or instead of any other punishment
D'fhéadfadh é seo a bheith i dteannta, nó in áit, aon phionóis eile
The amount of compensation which a court can order is limited to the amount it could award in damages in a civil case
Tá méid an chúiteamh ar féidir le cúirt a ordú teoranta leis an méid ar féidir leis an gcúirt a dhámhachtain i gcás sibhialta
│District Court │ €15,000 │
│An Chúirt Dúiche │€15,000 │
│Circuit Court │ €75,000 │
│An Chúirt Chuarda │€75,000 │
The court must take your means and your financial commitments into account when making a compensation order
Ní mór don chúirt d'acmhainní agus do thiomantais airgeadais a chur san áireamh agus ordú cúitimh a dhéanamh
Compensation orders may be enforced
Is féidir orduithe cúitimh a chur i bhfeidhm
For example, the court can order an attachment of earnings
Mar shampla, is féidir leis an gcúirt ordú um astú tuillimh a dhéanamh
Disqualification orders are not a punishment, but rather a finding that a person is unfit to perform the function from which they are disqualified, for example, drive a car
Ní pionós atá i gceist le horduithe dícháiliúcháin, ach cinneadh nach bhfuil duine inniúil don fheidhm óna bhfuil siad dícháilithe, mar shampla carr a thiomáint
The most common types of disqualifications are for convictions for driving offences
Is iad ciontuithe maidir le cionta tiomána na dícháilithe is coitianta

However, under Part 7 of the Companies Act 1990, a person, convicted on indictment of a criminal offence related to a company, can be disqualified from holding certain positions related to running a company, such as a director

Faoi Alt 7 d'Acht na gCuideachtaí 1990 áfach, d'fhéadfaí duine ar ciontaíodh é i gcion coiriúil maidir le cuideachta, a dhícháiliú ó phostanna áirithe a bhaineann le cuideachta a reáchtáil, mar shampla stiúrthóir
Endorsements and penalty points
Formhuinithe agus pointí pionóis
The Road Traffic Acts provide for a system of endorsements
Forálann na hAchtanna um Thrácht ar Bhóithre do chóras formhuinithe
An endorsement is an entry on a person’s licence record of either a court order of disqualification or of penalty points
Is éard is formhuiniú ann ná iontráil ar thaifead ceadúnais duine d'ordú cúirte dícháilithe nó pointe pionóis
There is more information in the document on penalty points
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil sa doiciméad maidir le pointe pionóis
Sex and drug trafficking offenders
Ciontóirí gnéis agus gáinneála drugaí
Orders for sex offenders
Orduithe do chiontóirí gnéis
As well as the general sentencing options available for all offences, a judge can make a number of specific orders when dealing with sexual offences
I dteannta leis na roghanna ginearálta pianbhreithe atá ar fáil maidir le gach cion, is féidir le breitheamh roinnt sainorduithe a dhéanamh nuair atá cionta gnéis i gceist
This is provided for by the Sex Offenders Act 2001
Forálann an tAcht um Chiontóirí Gnéis 2001 do seo
The following are the orders which a judge may make if you are a convicted sex offender:
Is iad seo a leanas na horduithe ar féidir le breitheamh a dhéanamh más ciontóir gnéis ciontaithe thú:
• Notification order: It obliges you to notify the Gardaí of your name and address
• Ordú fógra: Cuireann sé iallach ort d'ainm agus do sheoladh a chur in iúl do na Gardaí
• Certificate: It states that you have been convicted of the sexual offence, your sentence and that there is a notification requirement
• Deimhniú: Dearbhaíonn an deimhniú seo gur ciontaíodh thú i gcion gnéis, do phionóis, agus go bhfuil riachtanas fógra i gceist

• Obligation to notify employers: Where you are applying for employment which involves unsupervised access to or contact with a child or mentally impaired person, you are ordered to notify the employer or potential employer of your conviction for sex offences

• Oibleagáid le cur in iúl d'fhostóirí: Nuair a chuireann tú isteach ar fhostaíocht lena mbaineann rochtain ar pháistí nó ar dhuine faoi mhíchumas nach bhfuil faoi stiúir, tugtar ordú duit do chiontacht as cionta gnéis a chur in iúl don fhostóir nó don fhostóir féideartha
• Sex offender order: Where the Court believes it is necessary to protect the public from you, it can make such an order prohibiting you from carrying out certain activities
• Ordú um chiontóir gnéis: Nuair a chreideann an Chúirt go bhfuil gá ann an pobal a chosaint uait, d'fhéadfaí ordú a dhéanamh chun cosc a chur ort imeachtaí áirithe a dhéanamh
There is more information in the documents on the Sex Offenders Register and on monitoring of sex offenders
Is féidir tuilleadh eolais a fháil sna doiciméid maidir le Clár na gCiontóirí Gnéis agus maidir le monatóireacht a dhéanamh ar chiontóirí gnéis
Orders for drug trafficking offenders
Orduithe do chiontóirí gáinneála drugaí
The Criminal Justice Act 2006 introduced a system for convicted drug traffickers similar to those mentioned for sex offenders
Thug an tAcht um Cheartas Coiriúil 2006 córas isteach do gháinneálaithe drugaí ciontaithe cosúil lena bhfuil i gceist do chiontóirí gnéis
It allows the court to make an order which obliges you to notify the Gardaí of your name and address
Ceadaíonn sé don chúirt ordú a dhéanamh a chuireann iallach a chur ort d'ainm agus do sheoladh a chur in iúl do na Gardaí
The order is only made by the court if it considers that it is in the interest of the common good and that it is appropriate, given the circumstances of your case
Ní dhéantar an t-ordú ach amháin má bhíonn an chúirt den tuairim go mbeadh a leithéid d'ordú cuí ar mhaithe le leas an phobail, agus cúinsí do cháis a gcur san áireamh
More information is available in the document on the Drug Offenders Register
Tá tuilleadh eolais le fáil sa cháipéis ar Chlár na gCiontóirí Drugaí
Minimum sentences for firearm offences
Íos-phianbhreitheanna do chionta airm tine
Mandatory minimum sentences apply to certain firearm offences
Is iad seo a leanas na cionta lena mbaineann na pianbhreitheanna seo
The following are the offences to which this sentencing applies
Tá discréid ag an mbreitheamh i gcás an chéad chiona
